com.wpruszak.blitzch.lib

Class FileLoaderImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wpruszak.blitzch.lib.FileLoaderImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileLoader

    public class FileLoaderImpl
extends Object
implements FileLoader
    Default FileLoader implementation, it provides implementation of all the methods that FileLoader requires.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    setzo
    See Also:
    IOController, FileLoader, FileSaverImpl

    • Field Detail

      • SKIP

        private static final String SKIP
        Flag for skippable files in UNIX systems - some editors will create backup files besides the original one. The backup ones will have their names finished with '~' character. Since this app needs only one file to process it will skip all the backup copies
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getExtension

        private String getExtension(File file)
        Get file extension and return it as a String.

        If extension doesnt exists return FileBean.NO_EXTENSION.

        If filename ends with a dot return FileBean.ENDS_WITH_DOT.

        Parameters:
        file - to get extension from
        Returns:
        String extension

      • loadDirectory

        public List<FileBean> loadDirectory(File[] files,
                                    List<FileBean> fileBeanList)
                             throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileLoader
        Recursive load all files of a directory into List of FileBean objects, that will contain all of the files data.
        Specified by:
        loadDirectory in interface FileLoader
        Parameters:
        files - to load data from into FileBean beans
        fileBeanList - list of FileBean objects containing information about our files, this parameter can and should be initially null, cause the list is created after first iteration of the method anyway.
        Returns:
        List of FileBean objects
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O is corrupted
        See Also:
        FileLoader
